summary: This document is a preparation memo for the trial testimony of Larry Visoski, a pilot for Jeffrey Epstein. It records his previously undisclosed or clarifying recollections about Epstein's properties, aircraft, timeline of events, and his interactions with Ghislaine Maxwell and others. The document is subject to a protective order.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.context: Referred to as 'LV', he is the subject of the testimony preparation memo. He provides recollections about Epstein's properties, aircraft, and timeline of events.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'GM'. The memo records LV's recollections about her nickname, her travel frequency on Epstein's planes, her age when they met, and the timeline of her romantic relationship with Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JE'. The memo details LV's recollections about his properties (trailer, private island, Paris apartment), aircraft purchases (Boeing, helicopters), and his relationship with Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Gifunni
persons.context: Listed as an attorney present during the preparation of Larry Visoski's testimony.

persons.name: McGorty
persons.context: Listed as an attorney present by phone during the preparation of Larry Visoski's testimony.

connections.description: Visoski was Epstein's pilot, flying his planes and having knowledge of his properties and travel patterns.
Visoski knew Maxwell, recalls her nickname ('Larrold' for him), her travel frequency, and her age when they met.
Visoski recalls they had a romantic relationship that fizzled in the early 2000s.

events.title: Reduction in Maxwell's Travel
events.description: Larry Visoski recalls that Ghislaine Maxwell spent significantly less time flying on Jeffrey Epstein's planes around approximately 2005 or 2006.

events.title: End of Epstein-Maxwell Romantic Relationship
events.description: Larry Visoski recalls that the romantic relationship between Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell fizzled in or around the early 2000s.

events.title: Purchase of Private Island
events.description: Larry Visoski recalls that Jeffrey Epstein purchased his private island in or around the late 1990s.

events.title: Purchase of Boeing Aircraft
events.description: Larry Visoski recalls that Jeffrey Epstein bought the Boeing aircraft in or around 2000.

events.title: Flight Manifests Turned Over
events.description: Larry Visoski does not recall exactly when flight manifests were turned over to Jeffrey Epstein's attorney, but estimates it may have been around 2003.

locations: NM ranch (location of Epstein's triple-wide trailer)
Private island (purchased by Epstein in late 1990s)
Paris apartment (owned by Epstein, visited by Visoski 10-20 times)
keyFacts: Pilot Larry Visoski recalls Ghislaine Maxwell's nickname for him was 'Larrold'.
Visoski states the romantic relationship between Epstein and Maxwell 'fizzled' in the early 2000s, and her travel on Epstein's planes decreased significantly around 2005-2006.

Visoski provides details on Epstein's assets: a high-end triple-wide trailer at his New Mexico ranch, a private island purchased in the late 1990s, a Paris apartment, a Boeing purchased around 2000, and a frequent rotation of helicopters between 1999-2019.
Visoski estimates flight manifests were turned over to Epstein's attorney around 2003.
The document is explicitly 'SUBJECT TO PROTECTIVE ORDER' covering specific paragraphs, indicating sensitive or restricted information.
